member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager
member.summary: This class provides an (optional) easy and convient way to store mass amounts of asset references. This is useful for storing textures, SoundObjects, NPC references, and more. This class is not meant to be the end all be all of storing and managing assets. However, this is a good starting point for most mods.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.GetUniqueCount
member.summary: Get the amount of unique elements in the AssetManager.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Create an AssetManager with a custom set of types to be ignored. It is suggested you also add the types in AssetManager.defaultIgnoreTypes

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.#ctor
member.summary: Create an AssetManager with the default types ignored.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.ClearAll``1
member.summary: Remove all objects of type T from the AssetManager.

member.summary: Add a range of elements to the AssetManager, using the keyFunc to determine the keys.

member.summary: Add all resources of the specified type to the AssetManager, using the name as the key.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.AddFromResourcesNoClones``1
member.summary: Add all resources of the specified type to the AssetManager that are not created by mods/weren't created during runtime, using the name as the key.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Check if the asset manager contains the specified key.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.AddRange``1(``0[])
member.summary: Add a range of values to the AssetManager, using the .name of the object as the key.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.AddRange``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0})
member.summary: Add a range of values to the AssetManager, using the .name of the object as the key.

member.summary: Add a range of values to the AssetManager using a dictionary of object key pairs, with an optional prefix.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.AddRange``1(``0[],System.String[])
member.summary: Add a range of values to the AssetManager using an object array and a key array.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.AssetManager.AddRange``1(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Add a range of values to the AssetManager using a dictionary of object key pairs.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder
member.summary: A builder for procedural textures, AKA textures generated with other textures. This is slow! Please avoid using this for real time applications, preferably use when loading your mod!

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.GetAllTexturesWithTag(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all currently stored textures with the specified tag. Do not use this to get your finished textures! Use ExportAll for that!

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.Clip(System.String,UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.String)
member.summary: Clip the texture using all textures in the tag as masks, and put the results into the resultTag

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.SplitViaColor(UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.String)
member.summary: Splits the specified texture into multiple textures via color, and puts all the resulting textures into the specified tag. Only use this in specially designed images with few colors!

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.Trim(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Trims all the textures so that their bounds are only where there are visible pixels.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.CustomActionWithAll(System.String,System.Action{MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder,UnityEngine.Texture2D})
member.summary: Perform a custom texture action on all textures with the specified tag. Be sure to delete any textures you create that you dont add to the ProceduralTextureBuilder!

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.ExportAll(System.String)
member.summary: Export all textures with the specified tag, destroying all other textures.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.LoadTexture(UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a texture into the procedural texture builder with the specified tag.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.FlipAllHorizontal(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Flips all textures with the specified tag horizontally, storing the results into the resulting tag

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.AssetTools.ProceduralTextureBuilder.FlipAllVertical(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Flips all textures with the specified tag vertically, storing the results into the resulting tag

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.ConditionalPatchNoMod

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.IntrusiveAPIFeatures
member.summary: An enum for API features that change how the base game behaves internally/changes seeds, but doesn't effect or minally effects gameplay. All of these are off by default and must be explicitely turned on.

member.name: P:MTM101BaldAPI.MTM101BaldiDevAPI.Version
member.summary: The version of the API, applicable when BepInEx cache messes up the version number.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.MTM101BaldiDevAPI.EnableFeature(MTM101BaldAPI.IntrusiveAPIFeatures)
member.summary: Enables the specified intrusive feature. It is recommended to call this in the Awake method.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.MTM101BaldiDevAPI.PrefabSubObject
member.summary: The internal subobject used for converting objects into prefabs. Use this with GameObject.Instantiate as the parent transform to avoid manually having to clean stuff up.

member.name: P:MTM101BaldAPI.MTM101BaldiDevAPI.prefabTransform
member.summary: The internal transform used for object to prefab conversion. Use this with GameObject.Instantiate to prevent awake scripts from activating.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.MTM101BaldiDevAPI.CauseCrash(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Exception)
member.summary: Please only use this function for actual errors.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CullAffector
member.summary: GameObjects with this behavior makes the culling manager treat it as if it were a player. Useful if you have are using cameras that aren't the players'. Note that performance may take a hit if you use this, so use it with caution! (Maybe if the player isn't looking you could remove the component?)

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomAnimation`1.#ctor(System.Int32,`0[])
member.summary: Create an animation with the specified FPS

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomAnimation`1.#ctor(`0[],System.Single)
member.summary: Create an animation that is totalTime long.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomAnimatorMono`3
member.summary: A base for a monobehavior implementation of ICustomAnimator, including setting a default animation.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomAnimatorMono`3.useUnscaledTime
member.summary: Determines if this CustomAnimator should be affected by timescale.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomAnimatorMono`3.PopulateAnimations(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,`2[]},System.Int32)
member.summary: Populate the animations dictionary with a dictionary of keys and frame arrays with the specified FPS.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomSpriteAnimator
member.summary: A custom animator for sprites. Note that the animations do not serialize, so initialize them in the entities Initialize function.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomImageAnimator
member.summary: A custom animator for images. Note that the animations do not serialize, so initialize them in the entities Initialize function.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.CustomVolumeAnimator.sensitivity
member.summary: An optional animation curve to control the sensitivity.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Components.RotatedSpriteAnimator
member.summary: A custom animator for entities with rotating sprites. EX: First-Prize and Dr. Reflex

member.summary: Get all the level objects referenced by the specified SceneObject.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.CustomLevelObjectExtensions.GetCurrentCustomLevelObject(SceneObject)
member.summary: Returns the current level object for the specified SceneObject CoreGameManager MUST exist for this to not return null.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.CustomLevelObject
member.summary: A custom version of the LevelObject class, currently doesn't contain much else but it serves as a good base to make extending level generator functionality easy in the future.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.CustomLevelObject.MakeClone
member.summary: Makes a clone of this CustomLevelObject, preserving the custom mod data.

member.summary: Adds the specified key/value to the CustomLevelObject, allowing for storing extra, mod specific generator settings.

member.summary: ToString but for Extended enums. Only use on enums that are ints.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.EnumExtensions.ExtendEnum``1(System.String)
member.summary: Extends an enum, same effect could be achieved by casting an int, however this has a system to keep track of multiple enum additions from different mods to prevent conflicts

member.summary: Enum.GetName but with support for extended enums.

member.summary: Get an extended enum from a name.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Extensions.ConvertToPrefab(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert the GameObject into a prefab by moving its transform inside an internal GameObject marked as HideAndDontSave. It is automatically done for NPCs made with NPCBuilders and Items made with ItemBuilder. Use this method in AssetsLoaded.
member.param: If true, then the GameObject will be set to active. The components code won't run anyways.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Extensions.StopCurrentTransition(GlobalCam)
member.summary: Stops the currently running transition.

member.summary: Makes an object never unload from memory.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Extensions.RemoveUnloadMark(UnityEngine.ScriptableObject)
member.summary: Allows an object unload from memory.

member.summary: The color that won't have a new material generated for it.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified type supports button colors.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.Buttons.ButtonColorManager.ApplyButtonMaterials(GameButtonBase,UnityEngine.Material[])
member.summary: Applies the custom button materials to the button, automatically running the appropiate functions depending on the type.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.Buttons.ButtonColorManager.CreateButtonColor(System.String,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Creates a new button color and generates material variants for all registered button types.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType.Preparation
member.summary: Runs before everything else, including base. This is the only time a new level type can be added or a level type can be removed from a SceneObject. Attempting it in any other GenerationModType will throw an error.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType.Base
member.summary: This should be used for methods that override the majority of the generator properties, almost completely transforming the level.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType.Override
member.summary: This should be used for overriding only certain properties of the generator, such as changing exit counts.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType.Addend
member.summary: This should be used for adding onto already existing properties, such as adding characters or items. Most mods will be using this.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType.Finalizer
member.summary: Useful for removing things that might've been added or changed by other mods, or if for one reason or another you need the final say on something. Use with caution.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.FieldTripLoot
member.summary: A helper class used to store fieldtrip loot during the mod loading phase.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.CustomLoot
member.summary: A helper class used for easy modification of WeightedItemObject arrays and lists during the mod loading phase.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GeneratorManagement.Register(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GenerationModType,System.Action{System.String,System.Int32,SceneObject})
member.summary: Register a generator action, called during mod loading.
member.param: The plugin adding the generator modifiers.
The first parameter is the level name, the second one is the level id, and the last is the SceneObject itself.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GeneratorManagement.InvokeFieldTripLootChange(FieldTripObject)
member.summary: Invoke FieldTrip loot table changes for the specified field trip.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GeneratorManagement.RegisterFieldTripLootChange(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.Action{FieldTrips,MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.FieldTripLoot})
member.summary: Register an action that will be called to modify the field trip loot during mod loading. Unlike registering a generator action, you can only register one of these.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GeneratorManagement.EnqueueGeneratorChanges(SceneObject)
member.summary: This adds the specified SceneObject to the queue to be processed during the loading screen. Only use this for custom SceneObjecst you create. This will only work properly if called before the loading screen applies generator changes, aka not in post.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.GeneratorManagement.Invoke(System.String,System.Int32,SceneObject)
member.summary: Invoke the generator actions for the specified SceneObject.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ModdedHighscoreManager.AddModToList(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.String[])
member.summary: Adds the specified mod to the highscore list. Do this if your mod modifies endless mode but doesn't directly add any levels itself. Or, if you want to add tags. You can call this whenever you want to change tags.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.EndlessModeManagement.AddEndlessLevel(MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ModdedEndlessLevel)
member.summary: Adds an entirely new level to endless mode. This automatically adds your mod to the ModdedHighscoreManager.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.EndlessModeManagement.AddEndlessAction(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.List{EndlessLevelTypeContainer}})
member.summary: Adds an action to be called when the EndlessLevelTypeContainer array is being finalized. Use this to add sizes to existing levels or re-order things. This automatically adds your mod to the ModdedHighscoreManager.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder.Start
member.summary: Occurs before LevelObjects get converted to CustomLevelObjects

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder.Pre
member.summary: Occurs before level generator changes are performed.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder.Post
member.summary: Occurs after level generator changes are performed.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder.Final
member.summary: Occurs after localization has been loaded and the API's highscore mode has been determined. Use sparingly, in most cases you will want to use Post instead.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEvents.RegisterOnAssetsLoaded(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a loading IEnumerator that gets called when every asset has been loaded into memory and can be sorted through with Resources.FindObjectsOfTypeAll. The first yield return should be the amount of total amount of yield returns in the function as an int. The second yield return should be the initial loading text. Every yield afterwards should be a string that displays the next loading step.
member.param: If true, this will be called after the initial call, this is useful if you need to replace all references to something.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEvents.RegisterOnAssetsLoaded(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Collections.IEnumerator,MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder)
member.summary: Registers a loading IEnumerator that gets called when every asset has been loaded into memory and can be sorted through with Resources.FindObjectsOfTypeAll. The first yield return should be the amount of total amount of yield returns in the function as an int. The second yield return should be the initial loading text. Every yield afterwards should be a string that displays the next loading step.
member.param: The event in which assets will be loaded. Refer to LoadingEventOrder for more information on when each enum is invoked.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEvents.RegisterOnAssetsLoaded(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Action,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers an action that gets called when every asset has been loaded into memory and can be sorted through with Resources.FindObjectsOfTypeAll. Internally, it just creates an IEnumerator that calls toRegister.
member.param: If true, this will be called after the initial call, this is useful if you need to replace all references to something.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEvents.RegisterOnAssetsLoaded(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Action,MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEventOrder)
member.summary: Registers an action that gets called when every asset has been loaded into memory and can be sorted through with Resources.FindObjectsOfTypeAll. Internally, it just creates an IEnumerator that calls toRegister.
member.param: The event in which assets will be loaded. Refer to LoadingEventOrder for more information on when each enum is invoked.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.LoadingEvents.RegisterOnLoadingScreenStart(BepInEx.PluginInfo,System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Registers an event that gets called at the beginning of the Loading screen, before any assets are loaded. Typically, you'd want to just use your plugins Awake event, but if your mod tends to freeze the game at start up, this might be helpful to more properly convey what is going on.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.None
member.summary: This item has no necessary flags.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.MultipleUse
member.summary: // This item has multiple uses like the grappling hook.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.InstantUse
member.summary: This item should not appear in the players inventory and is used instantly upon pickup.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.NoUses
member.summary: This item doesn't do anything when used, regardless of circumstance. This is for items like the Apple, but not the quarter as it can be used in machines.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.Persists
member.summary: This item's behavior doesn't instantly destroy itself when used. This is applicable for the BSODA or the Techno Boots.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.CreatesEntity
member.summary: This item creates a physical entity in the world, this is applicable for the BSODA but not the Techno Boots.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemFlags.HasTutorialVariant
member.summary: This item has a variant in the tutorial that must be accounted for when handling MultipleUse.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.ItemMetaStorage.GetPointsObject(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the ItemObject for the points item with the specified(or closest) value.
member.param: The amount of points to try to search for
If true, the point count must be exact, otherwise it will return null.
member.returns: The found ItemObject, or the closest match if mustBeExact is false.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.None
member.summary: This NPC has no applicable flags.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.CanHear
member.summary: This NPC can respond to sound

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.CanMove
member.summary: This NPC can move linearly (Bully doesn't count)

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.CanSee
member.summary: This NPC can see/spot things

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.MakeNoise
member.summary: This NPC can make noise that Baldi can hear (First Prize)

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.HasTrigger
member.summary: This NPC's collider is a trigger (this excludes Chalkles and Bully)

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.HasSprite
member.summary: This NPC has a sprite in the schoolhouse, every NPC including Chalkles currently has this flag.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.IsBlockade
member.summary: This NPC can block other NPC's LOS or Navigation

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCFlags.NonStandardSpawn
member.summary: This NPC is spawned via other, non level generator/builder means (such as a StructureBuilder). EX: Student

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.NPCMetaStorage.ReplaceAllReferencesForCharacter``2(Character)
member.summary: Replaces all references to a specific NPC with a script attached of the same type. Useful if you replace an NPC with a custom type.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.RandomEventFlags.CharacterSpecific
member.summary: This event requires a specific character to work

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.RandomEventFlags.RoomSpecific
member.summary: This event requires a specific room to work

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.RandomEventFlags.Permanent
member.summary: This event makes permanent changes to the level

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.RandomEventFlags.AffectsGenerator
member.summary: This event affects the generator in some way(adding a character or room)

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.RandomEventFlags.Special
member.summary: This event isn't called through regular means, and shouldn't be added to the random event pool.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.Registers.SceneObjectMetadata.GetSupportedLevelTypes
member.summary: Get the level types supported by this SceneObject.

member.summary: NPCs are spawned as soon as the GameManager initializes.

member.name: F:MTM101BaldAPI.ObjectCreation.GameManagerNPCAutomaticSpawn.OnSpawnExit
member.summary: NPCs are spawned as soon as the player leaves the spawn elevator

member.summary: Makes the audio this NPC creates not be affected by time. This is done by setting the audio manager's pitchTimeScaleType to TimeScaleType.Null.

member.summary: Disables the NPC from automatically rotating in the direction it is moving.

member.summary: Determines how objects will be created

member.summary: Helper function to load mtllib statements

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.OBJImporter.OBJLoader.Load(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Load an OBJ file from a stream. No materials will be loaded, and will instead be supplemented by a blank white material.
member.param: Input OBJ stream
member.returns: Returns a GameObject represeting the OBJ file, with each imported object as a child.

members.member:
Load an OBJ and MTL file from a stream.
Input OBJ stream /// Input MTL stream The material to use as a base for any generated materials (Added by the MTM101Api) Returns a GameObject represeting the OBJ file, with each imported object as a child.

Load an OBJ and MTL file from a file path.
Input OBJ path /// Input MTL path
Returns a GameObject represeting the OBJ file, with each imported object as a child.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.OBJImporter.OBJLoader.Load(System.String,UnityEngine.Material)
member.summary: Load an OBJ file from a file path. This function will also attempt to load the MTL defined in the OBJ file.
member.param: Input OBJ path
The material that will be copied for all the newly created materials.
member.returns: Returns a GameObject represeting the OBJ file, with each imported object as a child.

member.summary: A stat modifier for the PlayerMovement's variables.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedItemIdentifier
member.summary: Stores the mod GUID and name of the ItemObject to allow it to be referenced later.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGame
member.summary: The root class for modded save games, storing the base game data, but restructured in a way that is more mod friendly.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary
member.summary: The main ModdedSaveGameIO class, these are to be inherited. Useful for people who want their savedata to be small. Or people who just like using BinaryReader/BinaryWriter

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.Save(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: When the game is saved, this function will be called to write the data.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.Load(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: When the game is loaded, this function will be called to read the data.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.OnCGMCreated(CoreGameManager,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When the CoreGameManager is created, this function will be called. Use this to attach a monobehavior that stores the data while play is in session.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.Reset
member.summary: When a file is deleted, this function will be called. Use it to restore settings to default.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.GenerateTags
member.summary: Generates the current set of tags. Used to seperate save files with different settings that effect generation, such as a toggle to make a character spawn always, for example.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.DisplayTags(System.String[])
member.summary: Displays the tags in a way that is more readable for players looking at their modded saves to figure out why they are different. Generally, you should keep tags readable even if DisplayTagsDefault is used like it will be if this mod isn't actively installed.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.DisplayTagsDefault(System.String[])
member.summary: The default function for displaying tags. Will be used if the mod is uninstalled or DisplayTags isn't overwritten.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOBinary.TagsReady
member.summary: Determines if tags are ready to be generated. Return false if tags are not ready to be generated yet, making the API load the first save with matching mods, ignoring tags for this mod. It is suggested to manually call the RegenerateTags function once tags are ready to be generated. This does not stop GenerateTags from being called!

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOText
member.summary: A version of ModdedSaveGameIOBinary, but for saving/loading plaintext. Useful for people who want to do something like splitting a comma seeperated string for their data.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIOJson`1
member.summary: A version of ModdedSaveGameIOText but it saves Json data. Useful for people who just want to serialize/deserialize an object and need not much else.
member.typeparam: The type of object you want to serialize.

member.name: T:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveGameIODummy
member.summary: A dummy ModdedSaveGameIO used for changing the save type to Modded for custom items. Simply writes a zero. Switch to ModdedSaveGameIOBinary and check for that zero to see if there is data to load if in the future your mod needs data.

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveSystem.AddSaveLoadAction(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.Action{System.Boolean,System.String})
member.summary: Allows you to add an action to be called when the game saves and loads, please only use this system if you plan to save data. The first value passed to the action is whether or not its saving (true if saving, false if loading) The second is the path allocated to your mod to save your modded save data

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.SaveSystem.ModdedSaveSystem.AddUnmanagedSaveLoadAction(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.Action{System.Boolean,System.String})
member.summary: Allows you to add an action to be called when the game saves and loads, please only use this system if you plan to save data. Unlike AddSaveLoadAction, Unmanaged SaveLoad actions are all given the same directory regardless of who is playing. The first value passed to the action is whether or not its saving (true if saving, false if loading) The second is the path allocated to your mod to save your modded save data

member.name: M:MTM101BaldAPI.ScriptableObjectHelpers.CloneScriptableObject``2(``0)
member.summary: Creates a ScriptableObject of type CloneType and copies the public values of OriginalType to CloneType. This clones by reference!
member.returns: The clone with all public properties from the original copied over.
